title: Hekla
summary: Hekla (Icelandic pronunciation: ​[ˈhɛhkla] (listen)), or Hecla,[2][3] is a stratovolcano in the south of Iceland with a height of 1,491 m (4,892 ft). Hekla is one of Iceland's most active volcanoes; over 20 eruptions have occurred in and around the volcano since 874. During the Middle Ages, Europeans called the volcano the "Gateway to Hell".
